message_2:
To factor the given polynomial, first look for the greatest common factor (GCF) of all the terms. In this case, the GCF is 4x. 

Now, factor out the GCF:

4x(x^2 - 3x + 2)

Next, factor the quadratic expression inside the parentheses:

x^2 - 3x + 2 = (x - 1)(x - 2)

So, the factored form of the polynomial is:

4x(x - 1)(x - 2)
